properties.description: Designed by Sir John Soane as a family home and country residence. Following a three-year conservation project,  Pitzhanger has been returned to Soane’s innovative original design and re-opened to the public in March 2019.
properties.name: Pitzhanger Manor & Gallery

properties.description: Built in 1893 as a printers' institute in the Anglo-Dutch style, with sandstone dressings, steeply pitched tiled roof and gables; many original features remain including the swimming pool and library reading room.
properties.name: St Bride Foundation

properties.description: A rare example of Thomas Archer's work and a masterpiece of English Baroque, originally dubbed Queen Anne's Footstool. A Grade I listed building, restored by Marshall Sisson after extensive bombing damage, now a busy concert hall.
properties.name: St John's Smith Square

properties.description: Founded by William the Conqueror's Archbishop Lanfranc in 1080 (the significant crypt survives) St Mary-le-Bow was rebuilt, notably by Wren after the Great Fire and by Laurence King in 1964 after WWII destruction. Home of Bow Bells.
properties.name: The City Churches: St Mary-le-Bow

properties.description: London's main tourist information centre is clad in a specially manufactured system of 220 pre-finished stainless steel panels. The subtly reflective surface provides a striking counterpoint to St Paul's. NOTE: Closed on Monday 19 September
properties.name: City Information Centre

properties.description: The independent cultural centre Pushkin House will contribute to this year's Open House Festival through a programme of events and community initiatives at its Grade-II listed building in Bloomsbury Square.
properties.name: Pushkin House

properties.description: Barking town centre has seen significant development over recent years with substantial growth in housing and infrastructure. These guided tours will visit existing award winning schemes and set out the vision for the future of the town.
properties.name: Barking Town Centre Tour

properties.description: St Anne's Limehouse has been described as 'the finest parish church in England.' Designed by Nicholas Hawksmoor, it is Grade I listed and one of the Major Churches in the Church of England. It is home to a thriving Christian congregation.
properties.name: St Anne's Church, Limehouse

properties.description: Built in the Gothic style with dressed flint and stone dressings. There are monuments to Joseph Glover (1628), Lady Dorothy Brownlow (1699), William Earl Talbot (1782) and Isaac Littlebury (1740). The churchyard has 5 Grade II tombs.
properties.name: St Nicholas Church

properties.description: The Gilbert & George Centre was originally established as a registered charity by the artist in 2009 with the objective to advance the education of the public in the arts, and generally to advance the arts, architecture, heritage, and culture for the benefit of the public.
properties.name: Gilbert & George Centre

properties.description:
Tour the UK’s oldest brewery site, once home to Young’s.
Walk/talk covers history & redevelopment, incl. new boulevard, square, river walk & restored listed buildings.
properties.name: Ram Quarter

properties.description: This new sundial faces East so gets only morning sun. It is 10 m. square and was opened in 2021, and is publicly accessible 24/7
properties.name: Fleet Street Heritage Information Project and Sundial

properties.description:
A great little museum set in the Grade 2 listed Ossulston Estate - a prime example of pre-war Social housing - based on Karl Marz Hof in Vienna.
Open Wednesdays to Saturdays throughout Festival 
Sunday 11th Event
properties.name: People's Museum Somers Town

properties.description: Our 1950's warehouse has been converted to provide a new home for creative studio Acrylicize, to provide a mixture of workshop spaces, co-working and traditional studio space, all centred around a large events and gallery space.
properties.name: The Art House

properties.description: Poroban is a multi-disciplinary design studio, based off Old Kent Road, specialising in low carbon building design. We are offering free design surgeries throughout September and are hosting an open day on Saturday 9th Sept.
properties.name: Poroban studio

properties.description: Based in Shoreditch since the start of the centaury and still family owned, Jerram Falkus would like to open its office doors, for visitors to see our unique garden and sympathetically refurbished offices, along with history of the company
properties.name: Jerram Falkus Construction Ltd

properties.description: In 2023, Bank/Monument station completed a major upgrade that increased the station's capacity by 40%. Yet while much of the Bank/Monument complex is new, the station dates back over 100 years.  This tour will showcase its history.
properties.name: Bank/Monument station

properties.description:
A walking tour exploring Hampstead Garden Suburb as an experiment in using architecture to foster a community, run by Calum Orr of the Hampstead Garden Suburb Trust. 

3 of 3 tours run by the Trust.
properties.name: The Architecture of Community in Edwardian Suburbia

properties.description: A floating roof of sound, GPS-triggered & accessed by headphones & Echoes app to playfully reframe public space as an essential community engagement. One of 15 in an international series drawing on Oskar & Zofia Hansen’s Open Form concept.
properties.name: London Open Form Pavilion of Air

properties.description: A residential family home. The architecture and design was created in collaboration with Studio 1 Architecture/Studio Fuse (practice has featured on Grand Designs) and Designer Decoresidence whose founder resides in the property.
properties.name: 33 Buchanan Gardens

properties.description: Architecture for London designed and built a new home for stationers Present & Correct in a heritage retail unit. In a nod to the neighbouring British Museum, cabinets as 'wunderkammer' display the stationery as objects of desire.
properties.name: Present & Correct Stationers

properties.description: A raft of influential creators who transformed British design and typography – including William Morris, Emery Walker, Edward Johnston and Eric Gill all lived in Hammersmith. Explore the area's artistic and political legacy in a walk combining beauty and usefulness.
properties.name: Art for the many: Hammersmith's radical river

properties.description: We will open the doors of our London office to showcase a selection of our projects, celebrating new buildings and the conservation of existing buildings in the historic context. We welcome discussion and debate from all.
properties.name: Donald Insall Associates - Selected Project Exhibition

properties.description: We propose to open the Museum of Croydon stores for an intimate guided tour of our stored collections also featuring an overview of collection care. This activity will take approximately 1hr and can cater for a maximum of 8 people.
properties.name: Museum of Croydon Behind the Scenes Tour

properties.description: Public Tours tours by Architect's DSDHA and the team at National Youth Theatre of the NYT's recently redeveloped RIBA-award-winning building, which created the UK's first theatre dedicated to staging work created by young people.
properties.name: National Youth Theatre

properties.description: Clissold House is an 18th century grade II* listed mansion located in Clissold Park. Bursting with original features such as sash windows and fireplaces it's an amazing place to visit.
properties.name: Clissold House

properties.description: A walking tour led by Footways London that demonstrates the guiding principles of the Camden Green Loop, a strategy to build public spaces that better serve local communities, including the Camden Highline.
properties.name: Camden Green Loop Walking Tour
